intro: Siphocampylus lauroanus, commonly known as the California starflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its star-shaped, showy flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
